column2: Debbie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been using this med. for 7 months. When I first started the dose was too strong. I was haveing frequent irregular bleeding, headaches,heart palpitations and bloating.My doctor had me cut the patch in half and this has been great for me. I was having 15-20 sweaty hot flashes a day, INTERCOURSE WAS VERY PAINFUL,I was depressed and moody. Now I still have these symtoms but they are greatly reduced which makes them more tolerable. The side effects I have on the patch are: itchy red skin at the patch sight. periodic red itchy pumps around belly button and croch area, weight gain and bloating.

column2: Cindy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 51 years old and have been using the Climara Pro patch for almost two years now. I love it! It has taken away my night sweats completely and my terrible mood swings. Have a little bit of bleeding every now and then but nothing major. I use a Tegaderm dressing over the top of the patch to make sure it stays on.  Works wonderful. So glad my doctor recommended Climara Pro!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Sleeping better and mood is better. Posts about problems with patch sticking made me worry about using this but ive has no problem and I swim often. I use Teagarden dressing over it and i swear it is invisible and I use a public group shower at the YMCA pool so this is important to me!

column2: hbovay, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I can't give this medication any good stars yet.  I am 58 and was given this patch for my continuing hot flashes.  Day 1 it stuck on my lower stomach / Day 3 came off - stuck it back on my upper thigh with medical tape as it would NOT stick / Day 5 off again as the medical tape gave up too. Will not restick and cannot get the patch off the medical tape.  Tried to just put more tape over top but patch will not adhere at all now and it was not touching my skin at all. HOW is anyone keeping it on?  I do shower EVERY day with no exceptions.  I also refuse to apply another patch for 2 days as I have to pay $35 for 4 patches now and refuse to pay more because the company has not used an adhesive that will stay attached to the skin.  ?????

column2: thc, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 4 months on this and answered severe day sweats. Challenging to keep on but finally got it. 6 weeks into treatment began spotting. Now, I have a very heavy period lasting one full week every other week for the fourth time now. Not sure what to do, P.A. said to cut into since I am already on lowest dose. Anybody out there with similar problems with heavy bleeding.

column2: CSF, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 52 and have been experiencing hotflashes for over 5 yrs. Dr. put me on Effexor (off label) and it worked very well. Just started this patch for hotflashes, night sweats, and vaginal dryness, low sex drive. It's staying on just fine. Hope to see the "good results" others have mentioned. I will use this for a while and switch back to Effexor, which was mainly for hotflashes, night sweats, insomina, and mood swings(although HARD to get off of).

column2: hoo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I love this patch. It stopped my hot flashes and vaginal dryness. I am nervous about being on it so long but it  definitely lets me have a much better quality of life. I can't blame any weight gain on it.I have kept the same patch on for 2 weeks at a time. I can't stand the idea of my dr.making me stop using it. Don't know what I'll use next

column2: LMW, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: So what if it relieves the symptoms if the patch does not stay on....many posts here confirm this problem. If you exercise or take a shower within 2-3 days the patch starts to peel away.

column2: cjcs, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: At 52, I began experiencing hot flashes, mood swings and insomnia. Thought I could 'tough it out', but the no sleep really affective my life. I have had no break thru bleeding, no problem keeping the patch on, and am very pleased with the results. I have not slept this well in 3 years, I am back to my old self, and hot flashes were gone within 3 days. Not excited about risks, but as my doc said, 'Quality of life is important." Amen!

column2: Carrie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm 50 yrs. old, and have had meno symptoms for 5-6 yrs.  My Dr. prescribed this product to ease the hotflashes. The medication took care of the hotflashes but within three weeks I started bleeding which turned into a full fledged period lasting a full week.  I continued to spot after that until the fifth week of use, I ended up with a full fledged bleed again!!  Really people!!  I haven't had my period for over five years and now this again?!?!.  I don't think it's one bit funny and I have no intention of putting up with that just to calm the hotflashes.  I'll go back on a natural product that doesn't cause these insain side effects!

column2: aussiegal, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 53 years old I was having problems with night sweats and my PMS was very bad.  Now this has almost gone away.  But the patch will only last for 3 days after that it drys out and falls off.  For the amount of money I have to pay for this it is a shame it does not last the 7 days that it states it should.

column2: Jasmine, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am very happy with this patch.  I am a 54-year-old woman who has been in menopause since age 51.  I have been using this for about one year now.  Hot flashes and night sweats stopped completely.  My sex drive is back, too.  I had a bit of spotting earlier on but that is very rare now.  For about four months now, I have been using three patches in three weeks and then I take a break for the fourth week with no patch on.  This has been working great for me doing it this way.  It does sometimes irritate my skin when I take it off, but I found that rubbing the area gently with lotion for how many days is needed takes care of that!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been using the patch for 5 wks now for hot flashes. It worked great right away but noticed some spotting first week.Then I starting gaining weight and bleeding more.I thought its was my period but now a week later my breasts are very tender and I'm bleeding again,backache,cramps.Don't know what to do if I stop using it the hot flashes will surely come back and I won't get any sleep!Has this happened to anyone and is there anything I can take instead that would help?

column2: Patrish McBeth, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am beginning year number five (and last)on this medication.  It has been a life-changer and saver for me.  My menopausal symptoms of hot flashes, night sweats, insomnia, vaginal dryness, dry skin - all gone.  I did have spotting during the first few months, but was told to expect it, and it was minimal.  No side effects, just huge benefits.  No problems with applying, or keeping the patch on.  Swimming in the ocean did cause the patch to lose its adhesiveness.  I am now stressing about what product to use next - am terrified of having my symptoms return, so many serious concerns about using these types of products.  Not sure how I would have survived these past few years without the patch - it has been such a wonderful option for me.

column2: Barb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I've been using the Climara Pro patch for about 18 months.  The only side effect I've experienced is breakthrough bleeding and spotting.  I'm trying to take a break but the hotflashes, mood swings and sleep disruptions are coming back!!  Also to keep the patch on, you must place it on an area free of lotions and oils.  Side note:  it is a bit pricey!!!

column2: cjcs56, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Have used ClimaraPro at 0.045/0.015 mg/day and love the results. Within the second week, I had no hot flashes, no insomnia and finally no mood swings! Had been on it 4 months when breast tenderness became extreme. Went off 3 months until symptoms became unbearable again. Back on it 2 months now and breasts are starting to get sore, will discuss with dr next month. No problems with patch sticking as long as I don't use creamy soaps or moisturizers and press firmly for at least 15 seconds. Lasts thru sweat and exercise if done that way.

column2: MJ, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I slept through the night the first day I used it, and my sweats and flashes decreased significantly.  I too, however, am having a heck of a time keeping it in place.  I play tennis and exercise quite often and the patch comes off in a few days with all the perspiration.  Hmmm...Bayer please modify it so that the adhesive is changeable with a more permanent patch.  Changing the adhesive and removing it during showers or exercise would probably be the answer.  I'll try surgical tape and tegaderm...whatever that is.

column2: Austin, Texas, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: THe good news...my life changed almost immediately. Hot flashes stopped, night sweats ended and the birds started singing and the sun started shining within a week! Even though it always left a red mark after I peeled it off I thought it was a little price to pay for regaining my life. BUT then after 10 months it began to burn and blister my skin to the point that I had to take it off. Immediately the old symptoms came back and I thought if I would just toughen up I could put in some virgin areas and it would be oK and mind over matter, but to no avail. My skin is blistered and maybe permanently scarred. I tried the CombiPatch which is an equivalent but the same thing happened immediately. I'm so depressed because I already feel this overwhelming doom feeling. I am about to start taking Activella and will see. I have called Bayer and given my story. I am praying they'll be enough women who report this sensitivity and they'll discover another product to use to adhere the patch because I'm a huge fan.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: my hot flashes and night sweats have completely gone away, but I've gained 10 pounds and my periods have returned.  The PMS is awful - I feel like I'm 15 again.  I know the drug is working, and I know I need the estrogen, but I'm considering changing to an oral medication so I can tweak the dosages so I don't feel so awful.  Ironically, I felt great before starting the medication (except for the hot flashes).

column2: andy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: using climara low dose)0.025mg) for about 9 months. Bit of a weight gain, but sleep great, no hot flashes. My only concern that I'm loosing my hair.Any solution  or idea,greatly appreciated.

column2: nona, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Night sweats and hot flashes gone almost immediately. Period returned after 3 weeks and got again after another 2 weeks. Not having any trouble applying or keeping patch on-don't even notice it's there.

column2: tsarina, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: have used for 12 plus years.use low dose . no weight gain . sleep great,no sweats .stays on me with no problem. skin area must be dry and no creams/moisturizers.if you have problems call the company........ they will work with you....

column2: pegpelca, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: in 10 days my whole life 'feels better'--the sky is blue--I waited way too long to try something and honestly i thought that my menopausal symptoms were not bad--they were BAD!!! I am 62 and finally feeling really good and 'female'---I hate the patch--so happy to hear that others find it cumbersome--my second one is on with 'duct tape'--yuk--after reading other experiences, I will get some surgical tape  and tegaderm--it is the most comfortable on my mid buttocks--but when it starts to come off, I can't see it--causes 'strange constant touching my butt' to be sure it is there.  I don't recommend duct tape--creepy and so attractive.  Anyway--I'm a very happy--feeling normal 'girl' again--thank you BAYER !!!

column2: Teacher, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for 4 months.  No more hot flashes, mood swings, and migranes gone.  By the end of the second week my hot flashes had stopped.  The first 2 boxes of patches would not stay on. I switched to CombiPatch in hopes of finding one that would stick better.  After one month on combipatch and numerous side effects(enormous appetite increase, weight gain exterme breast tenderness and daily bleeding) I went back to climara Pro and feel great!  Spotting has ceased, appetite normal, no breast tnederness, no problems with patches staying on, mood stable and return of energy!  Loving life again!

column2: Barbara, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken this for 4 weeks now, with no difference. I still get hot flashes. Have trouble like everyone else in keeping it in place, but also its leaves me with a rash. So now have 4 rashes across my tummy! At $60 a time - to expensive

column2: km355, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is wonderful!  In a short time, no hot flashes, no sweats, no insomnia.  Heaven!  Though I do wish my doc had warned me about possible spotting, which caught me by surprise.  I also use either surg tape or a tegaderm to cover the patch while showering/swimming.  Once the sweats were gone, the patch sticks well.

column2: miami57, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Cyndi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The side affects are HORRIBLE!  Are you kidding me?  This is an FDA approved drug?  Way to go FDA, you failed the consumer once again.  Before I could even use the 2nd week patch I had terrible stomach pains/cramping, bloating, diarrhea and vomiting.  All the sideaffects got worse by the day.  As soon as I pulled the patch off - I was getting better within a couple of hours.  What a ridiulous expensive product that never should have been approved.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for hot flases for about 5 months, I love it, it works great..However I have had a lot of hair loss the last couple of months. not sure if this is a side effect, could someone please let me know if they have experienced this side effect..thanks

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The patch is good for vaginal dryness if you can get the patch to stay on. I think the cons out weigh the pros. Breast soreness very difficult to deal with and my hot flashes have returned. I would definitely like to have a refund! I'm not going to be able to last with the patches not sticking.

column2: Deb McK, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started using this patch four months ago. My migranes and insomnia subsided almost immediately. My mood, anxiety and vaginal dryness improved greatly. The only negative side effects are breast tenderness for the last three weeks and I had some vaginal bleeding this morning. I also had a terrible time getting the patch to stick but I found a solution. I cover the patch with a "Tegaderm" dressing. It's a clear, waterproof,"breathable", adhesive dressing (used in the hospital to cover IV sites). You can buy them at the drug store (I went to Walgreens). Problem solved!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: If it starts to come off, I hold it on with a little clear, breathable surgical tape, which works great.  All of my symptoms have improved significantly.  I've had some light monthly bleeding, and a 2 to 3 pound weight gain in the first 3 months, but exercising and watching my weight was already part of my regular routine.  I'm very happy with the trade off!

column2: Lillymae, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken the patches since 1992, starting at age 48. I have not had any side effects so to speak and have been having good yearly check ups. I started halving them last year to start going off of them at some time and they are still effective. I have not gone through the hot flashes others have had. Very satisfied.

column2: calwilal, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this patch for early menopause (36 yo) I cannot keep the patch on my skin! I'm on my 4th patch in 2 days and they haven't been on continuously. They completely fall off without me knowing it and then I have to hunt it down around the house to be sure my kids and/or animals don't find it. After reading these reviews, it seems that a lot of people have the same problem. Why doesn't the company make some changes? I like the idea of asking the company for a refund noted in another review. I'm going to have to pay another copay for a new set of patches now!

column2: Stella, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had no problems adhering the patch to my skin nor is there any difficulty in keeping it on. The only drawback that I can identify is the price, but I think its cost is a small price to pay for a full head of hair, which was falling out in droves when I was on Prempro!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This patch is extremely expensive (about $60 for 1 month dose) and won't stay adhered.  Poor design!!!!

column2: tina@jkcp.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
mbaer1939@aol.com, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used this patch for 4 months before givingup on it. could not keep it on. had mild pain in my abdomen constantly. After discontinuing use I am left with a watery discharge that I never had with prempro. This has been going on for 6 months so, I think it must be a pemanent side effect. Has anyone else had this experience?

column2: bosler5, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first week I really felt a difference in my mood, and sweatiness. It has not made a difference yet in my night sweat, and insomnia. The Patch is really difficult to keep on, showering or just sweating prevents it from sticking for more than 3 day's! I'm trying to fix a health issue and the patch is creating a new headache.

column2: rallypoppers, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am unable to truthfully rate how effective this product might be because it will not stay adhered to my skin.  Even with my health insurance co-pay of $60.00 for 4 patches it is too expensive to have to put a new patch on every 48 hours.  If it can't stand up to the moisture from a hot flash, what good is it>  I'll be contacting the company for a refund.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It initially helped me sleep better and controlled my mood swings, and is the only easy-to-use form of preventing vaginal dryness...for a while I swore there was broken glass in there...But I have put on weight that I can't seem to take off even by controlling diet and increasing exercise.  I'm going off it for a while to see what happens...my husband will be my gauge as to whether I get cranky or not...

column2: Carol, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I found this patch to be difficult to keep on. The glue sticks to your skin but the patch does not, therefore I've had to use cloth tape to keep it on, especially during times where I'm exercising regularly.  when the patch is on it works, but the difficulty with keeping it on has meant the dosage has been inconsistent, resulting in alot of spotting/bleeding.  I've used it for a year, but I'm now looking for something else.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
